title: Use AskUserQuestion in continue command for session selection
description:
When `/dots-swe:continue` is run without a bead ID, it currently just lists the available sessions. 

Enhancement: Use AskUserQuestion to present the list of active beads/worktrees as selectable options instead of just listing them.

close_reason: Implemented interactive session selection using AskUserQuestion. Continue command now presents available sessions as options when no bead ID is provided. Added --format=json flag to continue.sh for programmatic parsing. Version bumped to 1.2.0.

title: [BUG] worktree-create skill loops don't execute - \! prefix only works on single lines
close_reason: Fixed by moving loop logic to library functions in worktree-lib.sh

comments.author: robert
comments.text:
## Problem

The `!for` loop syntax in skill markdown doesn't work as intended. Only lines that directly start with `!` are executed as bash commands. The body of loops is displayed as text but NOT executed.

## Example (worktree-create.md)

```markdown
!for branch in "$@"; do
  BRANCH_NAME="$branch"
  git worktree add -b "$BRANCH_NAME" "$WORKTREE_DIR" "$CURRENT_BRANCH"  # NOT EXECUTED
done
```

The `git worktree add` inside the loop never runs - it's just echoed as text. The skill appears to succeed but no worktree is created.

## Affected Commands

- `/dots-dev:worktree-create`
- `/dots-dev:worktree-delete` 
- Likely others using for loops

## Fix

Refactor skills to use helper functions in `scripts/worktree-lib.sh` instead of inline loops.

title: [feature] Auto-detect Xcode projects and use sibling worktrees
description: Worktree creation should auto-detect Xcode projects (*.xcodeproj) and create worktrees as siblings instead of nested in .worktrees/ to avoid Swift Package Manager local dependency path resolution issues. Detection: check for *.xcodeproj in repo root. If found, use ../$(basename $repo)-wt-$name pattern instead of .worktrees/$name pattern.
design: Detection: Look for *.xcodeproj files in the root of the git repo (e.g., ls *.xcodeproj 2>/dev/null). If found, create worktree as sibling using pattern: ../$(basename $PWD)-wt-$name. Otherwise, use existing nested pattern: .worktrees/$name. Modify the worktree-create skill to add this detection logic before the git worktree add command.
acceptance_criteria: 1. Xcode project (has *.xcodeproj): Creates worktree as sibling (../<repo>-wt-<name>), can build in Xcode without SPM path errors. 2. Non-Xcode project: Creates worktree in .worktrees/<name> as before. 3. Verify with real repos: test with Yap (Xcode) and another non-Xcode repo. 4. Git worktree list shows correct paths for both cases.

title: Beads sync.branch configuration error
description:
Beads sync fails with configuration error:

```
Error: sync.branch not configured (run 'bd config set sync.branch <branch-name>')
```

This appears when running doctor or other commands that check sync status. Need to investigate why sync.branch is not properly configured.
close_reason: Fixed both issues. Added doctor.sh script that was missing from plugin installation. Updated beads sync check to treat missing sync.branch configuration as informational rather than an error. Version bumped to 1.1.3.

title: Continue command doesn't properly detect worktrees
description:
The `/dots-swe:continue` command shows sessions as '(no worktree)' even when git worktrees exist.

Example:
```
You have two available sessions you can continue with:
  1. dots-claude-plugins-7vd (no worktree)
  2. test (no worktree)
```

But `git worktree list` shows:
```
/Users/robert/repos/objectiveous/GammaKit/.worktrees/gk-6xv.3  c188130 [gk-6xv.3]
```

The continue script isn't properly detecting or associating worktrees with sessions.
close_reason: Fixed worktree detection. Continue command now uses lsof to get actual working directory from session PID, allowing it to detect worktrees across all repositories. Version bumped to 1.1.2.

title: Fix permission denied error on continue.sh script
description:
When executing the continue skill, users get:
```
Error: Exit code 126
(eval):1: permission denied: /Users/robert/.claude/plugins/cache/dots-claude-plugins/dots-swe/1.1.0/scripts/continue.sh
```

The script file is not executable. Workaround is to call with `bash` explicitly:
```
bash "$(ls -td $HOME/.claude/plugins/cache/dots-claude-plugins/dots-swe/*/scripts/continue.sh 2>/dev/null | head -1)"
```

Root cause: scripts are not being installed with execute permissions.
close_reason: Fixed script permissions. Scripts continue.sh, finish.sh, and swe-lib.sh now have execute permissions (mode 755). Version bumped to 1.1.1.

title: Doctor command not found in plugin installation
description:
The `/dots-swe:doctor` command fails because the doctor.sh script is not included in the plugin installation.

Error:
```
Error: Exit code 127
no matches found: /Users/robert/.claude/plugins/cache/dots-claude-plugins/dots-swe/*/scripts/doctor.sh
```

The script exists in the source but is not being packaged/installed with the plugin.
close_reason: Fixed both issues. Added doctor.sh script that was missing from plugin installation. Updated beads sync check to treat missing sync.branch configuration as informational rather than an error. Version bumped to 1.1.3.
